content.detailedDescription:
It was around 10:30 pm. i went out to watch some fireworks. i was looking straight south and noticed some red lights moving toward me. initially, i thought they were glowing embers that were falling straight toward me. but i soon realized they were heading straight north, and my location had made it seem they were falling toward me.  

still thinking they were embers, i kept waiting for them to fade out, but they never did. they were moving at about the speed of a helicopter or a small general aviation plane. when they passed overhead, i listened for a sound, but i heard nothing whatsoever. since it was dark, all i could see were the lights, and nothing about the object's shape. 

i consider myself pretty knowledgeable about aircraft, and i can't think of anything these could be, other than meteors? they had just the red light, no other colors or lights.
content.summary: Red glowing lights fly over west wichita

content.detailedDescription: Me and my friend was outside looking at the fireworks when we looked and saw something werid looking weird my friend looked over at me and said what was that is was orange/red thing hovering up in the sky and then disapperd out of nowhere there  we came in to tell someone on what we saw and then walked back out side and saw bout 9 more come and go i tried to debunk it as either  a plane or a lantern  but this looks nothing like that .. it ended soon after the fireworks arounf the neighborhood did
content.summary: Orange/red ufo

content.detailedDescription: I was at the bartlett park district fireworks show where three ufos appeared before the finally with a fourth trailing behind. they remained stationary right next to the fireworks until they were over and then began their path. they would disappear and reappear. it lasted for about 5 min until only one was left then that finally disappeared as well. it didn't look as though they flew away but more like they just shut off their lights. the lights were red orange similar to fire work ashes but stuck around for far too long to be that. plus the re appearing and disappearing wouldnt allow this to be possible. many people sitting near us saw them. very odd experience.  i forgot my phone in the car so didnt catch a picture.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: bartlett park district fire works display

content.detailedDescription: after firework above horizon higher than moon a starlike light flew from one part of the sky to the other stoped zig zagged then flew back to part of the sky where it wss sighted then another orb appeared close and both orb stood stationary and flew awat in different directions.
content.summary: After firework above horizon higher than moon a starlike light flew from one part of the sky to the other stoped zig zagged then flew back to part of the sky where it wss sighted then another orb appeared close and both orb stood stationary and flew awa

content.detailedDescription: after firework above horizon higher than moon a starlike light flew from one part of the sky to the other stoped zig zagged then flew back to part of the sky where it wss sighted then another orb appeared close and both orb stood stationary and flew awat in different directions.
content.summary: After firework above horizon higher than moon a starlike light flew from one part of the sky to the other stoped zig zagged then flew back to part of the sky where it wss sighted then another orb appeared close and both orb stood stationary and flew awa

content.detailedDescription:
Was watching fireworks with neighbors and saw a big bright light in the sky moving very slowly. north east of las vegas. and then it just very slowly disappeared. and i know it was not the iss. which i have seen many times. very strange. what ever it was it was not a plane or a meteor. very strange.
right around 9:pm our time.
content.summary: Hugh bright slow moving light in the sky. round in shape.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside smoking a cigarette. it's the fourth of july so occasional fireworks were still popping off, but they were very distant. i saw a glowing red-orange oval shaped thing slowly flying from right to left above the treetops. then two more flew slowly by. i ran up onto my backporch and yelled for my mom and dad to come outside. as they came a fourth went by, which is the first they saw. then 3 more came by. the last two wavered more than the others. i was terrified. i lost sight of the objects as they flew off behind trees behind my house. i hope other people in this area also saw these things, whatever they were. i tried to shoot video, but its nearly impossible to make out.
content.summary: 7 glowing ovals flying across hwy280

content.detailedDescription: Watching fireworks as all the neighborhood - earlier saw many orange red orbs that did not fit regular airline traffic or firework patterns. after the major fireworks went off by the major organizations, i just watched the neighborhood folks in their yards displaying their fireworks. i went to move my car to the street and saw a huge bright red led square hovering over a tree - i watched it and it did not move, i stood there for about a minute or two and moved on - but the square red light did not. after i moved my car from the driveway - i saw the huge orange full moon, i ran into the house and came back out to my backyard and found a huge orange red triangle hovering over the neighbors yard and moving towards mine. the neighbors were looking at it to. as , the object came over to my yard, several objects were coming out of the horizon towards the triangle. the triangle just disappeared over the house and the objects just kept coming one by one or two by two. the electricity to the house went haywire and the air conditioners stopped and turned back on like they were going to explode. the garage light went on by itself, the neighbors then came out and asked me if the power went crazy at my house and i said yes. the red orange lights floated in/out and disappeared over about half hour.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Large triangle floats over with red orange lights that follow - electricity goes crazy

content.detailedDescription:
I was over my boyfriend's coworker's house and we we're lighting fire works. i noticed an orange light over to the right hand of me and started staring at it. my boyfriend noticed me looking at it and started staring at it also. as i watched it hover, another came up from the lower right of it and moved fairly quickly. it almost went under the first one. at first i thought it might have been an airplane or helicopter, but there was no flashing lights. i couldn't see any other stars either due to cloud cover. these orbs were right under the clouds. i started down the street so i could get a better view because of the houses and trees. i saw them both moving now. i thought they were descending at first but my boyfriend caught up and he notice them heading east into the clouds instead. another weird thing that happened in elmont, related possibly, was a very weirdly contained thunderstorm. this happened about ten minutes after the sightings and it happened in a cloud formation to the left of where the orbs had been. it lasted all through a good 20 minutes. the storm moved at a fairly fast pace with the cloud heading southeast.

i called my friend who was in king's park at the moment and not even five minutes i hang up with her she tells me she saw the same ones i had seen. at about 11:10pm she calls me freaking out, she was now at our home in selden. she along with her parents and neighbors witness about 19 orbs over the sky above them. each time one would go by there would be a flash in the sky, like thunder. they have video and photos which i will attempt to put up later on.

this isn't the first time i'm seeing orange orbs though. my boyfriend and myself have witnessed one about a month ago in selden also. my friend witnessed one on monday.
content.summary: Two ufos in the sky towards the north east and also appearing in more locations

content.detailedDescription: At approximately 9:14 pm est, my fiancee and i were on our porch watching fireworks. i turned to look at light near a neighbor's home and noticed a light that looked odd. it was still quite far away, i would say nearly 1.5-2 miles east of us17-92 at that point. it floated closer to us at a very slow rate (taking about 7-8 minutes), as it got closer it began to resemble a fireball. like if you were able to ignite a balloon and keep it in the air. it was flying at a low altitude, maybe 600-700 ft. as the object moved north, it seemed to rotate, and change direction around the fireworks. it then seemed to stop and hover for nearly 2-3 minutes, until it just kind of lifted into the air and moved very quickly out of sight. my fiancee and i stopped and looked at at each other with our jaws on the ground and our hair standing up, wondering what we just saw.  we ran into the house to grab binoculars; when we returned, we noticed that there were several planes at different altitudes, and different speeds circling over.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Orange city 7-4-12 9:14p.M. fireball

content.detailedDescription: Did. anyone else see them ? idkif they where some sortiffireworkbut they did not seem so where moving fast and upward and there was thirteen or so in a row that flew out from the ocean
content.summary: Came out of the ocean while fireworks started pulsates yellowish orange into sky then disappeared there was about 13

content.detailedDescription:
Home, watching fireworks

a firework nearby

sparks

fly in an arc upwards then speed up and go straight then disappear in mid air

unsure, shocked, questioning.

disappeared completely after about 30+ orbs
content.summary: Orbs flying in an arc then going straight then disappearing

content.detailedDescription: I was in my boyfriend's florida room watching fireworks because it was extremely hot out and there were a lot of mosquitos.  all of a sudden he pointed at the sky and said what was that. we ran outside to see an orange-red orb floating fast through the sky at the tree lines. it was about the size of a basketball and it didn't seem to far away.  we live near an airport so the first thing we thought of was a plane or a helicopter, but there was no sound or flashing lights it was just a constant glowing circle moving faster than any of the planes we see daily.  it moved from left to right through the sky and about maybe 10 minutes or more after we saw it again, making the same flight pattern.  first thought that came to my mind was a meteor or something like that but i feel like the light would have at least pulsated instead of staying a constant glow.  we kept asking each other what the "f**k" is that and could not believe our eyes.  after the second time i ran inside to grab my camera, but we never saw it again.
content.summary: Orange-red orb flew in a straight line past the trees out of eye sight.  then 5 minutes later was seen again.

content.detailedDescription:
We were coming home from taking my sister-in-law home. we were driving on a rural road, when my husband commented "that's a funny looking airplane."  at that point, we took a closer look and realized that it was not an airplane. the object was moving west to east, and had a pulsating, reddish-orange glow.  it was dusk, not quite dark yet.  the object seemed to move with purpose, not too fast or too slow.  my husand thought the object was round, but when it was directly over our car, i thought it was diamond shaped.  we watched it as long as we could, until it eventually faded out.

we thought that was the end of it.  when we got closer to home, approximately 5-6 miles from where we originally saw the object, we noticed another one.  we live in a different town than my sister-in-law.  this object appeared to be the like the one we saw earlier, approximately 10 minutes after we saw the first object.  it was also moving west to east. 

then, when we turned on the road leading to our house, we saw another object straight ahead.  this object was moving west to east as well. we followed it as far as we could, until it faded out.

we turned around and went to our house.  as i got out of the car, i saw another object, this time moving north to south.  my husband ran into the house to grab some binoculars.  he ran out of the house, and tried to get a better look at the object, but wasn't successful.  the object moved out of the range of our vision.  within several seconds, we saw another object moving north to south.  again, we were unable to get a clear picture.  my husband grabbed his telescope, but by that time, we could no longer see the object.  shortly after that, we saw another one, this time moving south to north.  we watched this one until it faded away.  my husband turned around and saw approximately 6 of the same objects coming over the trees on the west side of our house.  these objects were moving in a north to south-easterly direction.  by this time, my husband ran to our neighbors house, they were outside doing fireworks.  he asked if they had seen the lights, and they responded that they thought they might be chinese lanterns.  however, upon coming indoors, i looked chinese lanterns up on the internet and found that they "float" along with the direction of the wind.  there was no wind blowing in any direction.  these objects appeared to be moving in several different directions, so that does not seem to make sense. i also looked up images of chinese lanterns, and they did not resemble what we saw at all.  

we realize that this was july 4th, however, please be assured that what we saw was not fireworks.
content.summary: Many glowing moving objects, from several directions, some single, some in groups. appeared to fade out, but more or same ones reappeared.

content.detailedDescription: Went out to look at bartlett city fireworks display from my patio as looking east from my location @ approx .5 miles. all at once see one bright orange orb like ufo passing perhaps 400-? ft. above highest ongoing fireworks display in a large (perhaps mile) circle like pattern obscured at times by tree line from my vantange point. going inside to retrieve camera i came out to see three same such orbs circling the display with two of them close to one another and the third following behind at some distance. managed to take a horrible picture of the last orb prior to the fireworks ending and seeing no more of them after the event. these orbs exihibited no more than an 'orange glow' and doubt that this would be a ruse of three private pilots performing a stunt as no sound could be heard during lapses in fireworks and only a orange glow was seen with no plane 'identifiers' (green/red) seen. i'll be waiting to see if another report turns up on this as it was unusual
content.summary: During city fireworks display first one then three bright orange orbs of size seen wide circling of fireworks display

content.detailedDescription: Lights hovering in the sky to the e-ne.  my wife, myself and my children were driving n on 71 hwy, through belton, mo.  off to the e-ne of the highway, we saw lights that were intermingled with fireworks.  initially we dismissed them as still burning fireworks, but they stayed there for a solid 5 minutes or more.  3 appeared to form a very large triangle, and were completely stationary.  we observed these lights from a  distance for approx. 5 minutes, and they continued to stay in this pattern for the entire time they were off to our front and right, as we passed, and until we could no longer see them in the distance behind us.  we also saw 2-3 more in the general area, but not forming the triangle shape.  at no time did they move, they were stationary the whole time.
content.summary: Saw multiple lights to the e-ne while driving n-nw through belton, mo

content.detailedDescription: I was outside watching fireworks when i noticed this bright light descending and then there was another that appeared that was ascending when they got very close together they stopped and hovered they were too close together to be helicopters then they both coninuted on there original routes the. just faded away into the night sky
content.summary: 2 bright lights

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting at home watching fireworks out of my window, and then i saw a small orange orb fly slowly across the sky. soon after, another came, i've seen eight so far, and they appear to be changing shape, multiplying, changing speed and directions, and glowing at different intensities.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.shape: Circle,   Disc,   Egg,   Flash,   Oval,   Sphere,   Star-like
content.summary: Multiple flying orange-ish orbs flying across the sky..

content.detailedDescription: It seemed to be going slow, went straight then curved. suddenly started going straight up till it disappeared. today was the fourth of july. 6 people saw it with me in the sky as fireworks went off. maybe the noises scared it off as it was probably stationed somewhere in the woods?
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: It seemed to be going slow, went straight then curved. suddenly started going straight up till it disappeared

content.detailedDescription: Saw object approach from the south off the horizon filmed it as it approached. it was just a small red/orange unblinking light and there seemed to be a small hazy cloud around it but cloud wasn't part of emission that i could tell. it made no noise at all. my husband an atc has no idea what it could be, he actually filmed it. i have the film on my cell phone if you'd like to see it contact me.
content.summary: Bright red/orange light moving south to north

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside when i heard a buzz...At first i thought it was someone flying and motorized hanglider (with a large propeler and a parachute on top). then i saw the rcmp (police) helicopter...This helicopter routinely flies over the st-john river, patroling the canada-us border.
a few seconds after seeing the helicopter, i noticed coming from the south 1, then 2, then 3, then 4 objects, appearing like flying balls, but flattened a little bit, and grey colored, in formation.
these objects appeared to be following the helicopter. the helicopter flew straight over st-leonard, but the objects turned and flew a perpendicular path, crossing somewhere between st-leonard and grand-falls, a town about 10 miles away. it was difficult to tell the height of the objects. they continued for a few miles then turned and seemed to head away from us, and then proceeded into the low cloud cover. the sky was partly cloudy at the time. at first my wife could't see them because they were so small, but she eventually did see the last 2 before they went into the clouds.
strange thing...The helicopter flew a bit further north of town and then circled a large area for about 30 minutes, something i had never seen it do before. i theorize they had radar and were keeping track of the objects, until they eventually went out of radar range.

i spent the while evening ready with my video camera but didn't see the objects again.
content.summary: 4 objects sighted between st-leonard and grand-falls, new brunswick

content.detailedDescription:
I am a retired school administrator and was driving tractor on a farm east a couple miles east of prescott, wa.  near the top of a steep sidehill, i could look down on the field below me and saw three large circles in the soil.  the circles appeared to be 70 to 100 feet in diameter.  having grown up on  a farm, i know of no explanation for them to appear in the soil.  they looked like perfect dark circles.  i asked the owner of the farm if he knew of anything that was done at that location that could have caused them and he said no.  on the sidehill in which they were located, i don't know how any man-made circles could have been made. i can think of no explanation for them.

i didn't have a camera with me but they are located above a gravel road so would be easy to access on foot by climbing the hill.
content.summary: Saw 3 large perfect circles in the soil on a farm where i was driving tractor.  no explanation for them.

content.detailedDescription:

i didn't have a camera with me but they are located above a gravel road so would be easy to access on foot by climbing the hill.
content.summary: Saw 3 large perfect circles in the soil on a farm where i was driving tractor.  no explanation for them.

content.detailedDescription:
While taking my evening walk around my neighborhood around 9pm, i was paying special attention to the sky as it was the 4th of july and the fireworks were starting in my neighborhood. i noticed a bright orange object in the southwest sky, under the clouds. i first thought it was a helicopter as it was moving at a good rate of speed from south to north. 

i looked in all directions around me and saw various fireworks going off, but this remained bright and steady. i watched for about 2 minutes when it took a westerly turn and went into the clouds. the light didn't flicker or pulse like an airplane light. the light was steady and almost reminded me of the light given off by a rocket or the space shuttle, which i had seen in the past. however, there was no contrail. the object made no sound.
content.summary: Bright orange light in the sky

content.detailedDescription: Trangle shaped object with 3 bright lights, crossed over the hwy in front of us driving thru the arizona desert. my husband at the time and i drove team together. we saw it and i said, is that a plane..No it was no plane.  by the time i got out of my seat to get the video camera it was gone. i've seen many strange things in the sky in my travels. i will keep a better record as to where it took place. many other truck drivers that night saw the same thing, they were all talking about it on the cb.
content.summary: Driving down hwy object passed on horizon across the sky in front of us

content.detailedDescription: We went out fishing out to stump pond in lincoln. we stayed until dark and when we packed up i looked up and i seen a triangle shaped object
content.summary: Triangle

content.detailedDescription: Liberty mo. july 02 2012, i was sitting on my front porch looking at the sky, being an amateur astronomer for 45 years; well thats what i do.  at 10:15 pm i noticed a bright light coming up from the east behind the trees, like a helicopter spot light. but it had a strange tint to it (amber with orange glow) like it was behind a fire, my first thought. well it was getting brighter (closer) and when it cleared the trees for a lack of words it looked like a flying flame! so i rubbed my eyes to get the best look i could. it was in a lazy left turn (my left) and the only clear sky i had was the width of the house across the street. it seemed about 2000 feet up and less than a mile away.  it was very bright, hard to look at bright. the object itself was a sphere/orb it was emitting an aura that looked like a plasma flame. i dont know what it is but for now i will call it plasma. now very close to the orb the color was a very bright blue/white and as the plasma moved away from the orb it took on an amber color. the plasma seemed to go about 75% upward, 50% forward, 50% backward, and 25% downward in the shape of a flame. i could see what looked like interference lines in the plasma and seemed to be in motion (twinkle). this whole thing seemed to be surrounded by a containment field that glowed orange (like when you put your hand on a plasma ball-lamp). the speed it was going was about the same as a conventional aircraft and was silent. it left my view heading to the nne direction, mosby and excelsior springs area. thats my 2 minutes with it. my opinion is this was a display look at me kind of thing. also as it left i could hear a jet in a turn west of me, like kci was diverting traffic away from the area.
content.summary: Fire in the sky

content.detailedDescription: While walking in my neighborhood with my girlfriend we witnessed a reddish/orange light in the sky about 10:05 pm 7/3/12. we were facing east and the object came from the south heading north. it varied its speed and actually stopped and hovered it moved up and down slightly and moved on a curve. it appeared to begin moving away from us to the northeast and then the light disappeared. when we arrived home we kept looking to the northeast and saw it again off in the distance moving non linear and then it disappeared into a tree line. we noted the time and the fact there was no wind at the time and commented on the fact there was no sound from the ufo. did anyone else report this?
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Observed an orange red light in the sky moving south to north no sound didnt move like an aircraft

content.detailedDescription:
I was home in the kichen eating at the table in the dark, starring out the open window toward denver, which is over 250 miles away, 07-04-12 at 2:50am
the morning was absolute clear and quiet.

i am always seeing lights on the jets flying over at night. thought it was a white light on the wing of a jet... wham! a flash, wham, it grew 500 times the size. i thought the jet blew up.

i reported the event to a on line news paper, told them i saw a jet explode over denver. nope, nothing on the  news this morning? 07-04-12 

then i sat and recalled what i felt and saw at the time. (maybe)  i know now i saw a intellegence of some kind, with thought transference ability, white, pure, glowing, gentle, smiling. it was small at first and i could just about see it. it turned sharply to me and grew very larg, and starred at me, it read my mind...  it knew i was watching,   then i felt drained,
then i felt ok  

then the entity turned west, went north leaving a tail of white
 
wallace hill lamar colorado
content.summary: Sm flash-propelled-stopped-glowing eye-looked right at me-smiled-said something-
